body_content.explanation: the process of cauterizing body tissue (= burning it to stop bleeding or infection, or to remove harmful cells) using a special needle that is heated by an electric current:
examples: Surgeons will usually use electrocautery during surgery to cut tissue or seal up blood vessels.
Use of electrocautery should be avoided during deep dissection.
Sometimes skin tags can bleed extensively when removed, requiring electrocauterization.
